liam.util

Class ValueHolder<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • liam.util.ValueHolder<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type for the value held.

    public final class ValueHolder<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is meant to be used to deal with using local variables with anonymous classes. This class can store a value which needs to be set within the body of an anonymous class without having to be final or effectively final. For example: 
     
 	String name = "Peter";
 	Runnable runnable = () -> {
 		name = "Rohan"; // Error: local variable must be (effectively) final!
 	};
    However, using the ValueHolder class, this problem can be avoided: 
     
 	String name = "Peter";
 	ValueHolder<String> nameHolder = new ValueHolder<>();
 	nameHolder.set(name);
 	Runnable runnable = () -> {
 		nameHolder.set("Rohan"); // Works!
 	};
 	name = nameHolder.get();
    Generic type parameters are used for type safety.
    Author:
    Liam
